description: I have Participated in an unoficial game jam at the CRI with people of the Game Lab. We design the first prototype using game design methods.
details: It is a hunting game based on sounds experience. because the feedbacks of the game are sounds, it can be played by both blind and non blind people.

description: I have participate an unoficial game jam at the CRI with people of the Game Lab. We produce a first playable prototype of the game.
details: It is a hunting game based on sounds experience. because the feedbacks of the game are sounds, it can be played by both blind and non blind people.

description: Participation in a two weeks S.T.E.A.M winter school hosted in a maker space in Mumbai. We, my team and me, used design thinking methods and principles (personae, rapid prototyping, interviews...) to work on our project.

Participation in a two weeks S.T.E.A.M winter school hosted in a maker space in Mumbai. During those two weeks I programmed a geolocation mobile-base tracker and web visualisation of the real-time position and past positions of the GPS tracker. Those two tools were related to our team project.
I have designed a game that aims to teach how to program to kids based on a block system, like Scratch. I used game design methods and principles I have learnt in game design classes.

Program a game that aims to teach how to program to kids based on a block system, like Scratch. I programmed both the client and the server for this game. It is based on JavaScript, Vue.js for the front and Node.js with Express.js for the server.

I Co-created the CRI Code Club, a student association that aims to foster digital literacy, for everyone. I have learnt how to create, start and run a project from scratch on the long term but also how to communicate around an idea and a project. I animated workshops and traning sessions for students, refugees and others.

project: Freelancing in web and mobile development
description: I Created my own company and then became a freelance web and mobile developer

project: Reading 'La vie algorithmique, critique de la raison numérique'
description: A book giving a philosophical reflexion and criticism toward the "digital reason". It helped me to be more critical toward digital and digital excesses.
details: Bookname - 'La vie algorithmique, critique de la raison numérique', by Éric Sadin.

description: This book is an essai giving a reflexion and a criticism toward the use of digital devices at school, and why digital devices cannot replace books.
details: Bookname - 'Dans la nuée', by Byung-chul HAN

description: This book gives a philosophical reflexion and criticism toward the use of digital devices (social networks, big data...) in modern societies
details: Bookname - 'Contre le colonialisme numérique', by Roberto casati.

description: Conduct a scientific litterature review in order to address the question of 'consultancy as a learning strategy'.
Propose a research protocol in order to tackle the possibilities to envision consultancy settings as learning strategies.
I have done, with another person, in a fablab, a project to express plants activity (vibrations, electricity...) into sounds/music. We used an ECG, an Arduino and processing in order to acheive this.

I have done the framing of a MOOC 'comment faire son laboratoire d'innovation publique ?' during an Intership in the innovation Lab of Pôle emploi (french national administration for employement). I faced the constraints and important points of designing a MOOC. I did the first drafts of the pedaogical ingineering of the MOOC.
I have learnt by myself Machine learning and deep learning. I used videos, open source projects, and tools like Keras, Tensorflow and PyTorch.
I have learnt blockchain and decentralized application by myself. To do it, I used ethereum, solidity, web3.js, etc.
I have animated during the whole 2018 year a weekly workshop on digital production / creation (web, games, IoT...) for kids from 11 to 14 in an society called Le temps des cerises.
I have designed a weekly workshop curriculum on digital production / creation (web, games, IoT...) for kids from 11 to 14 in an society called Le temps des cerises, for the whole 2018 year.
